meanings.definition: To sing louder or better than someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the competition, Sarah outsings all her friends.
meanings.sent2: She always outsings her brother when they sing together.
meanings.sent3: The little bird outsings the big parrot in the morning.
meanings.sent4: Her voice outsings the sound of the crashing waves.
meanings.sent5: The opera singer outsings all others with her powerful voice.

meanings.sent1: In the choir, John outsings everyone with his beautiful voice.
meanings.sent2: She outsings her classmates in the school talent show.
meanings.sent3: The cat tries to outsings the dog in their musical battle.
meanings.sent4: His voice outsings the melody of the entire orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The nightingale outsings all other birds in the forest with its enchanting song.
